level.text: There shall be no intervenors as a matter of right in RACD proceedings, but intervenors may be permitted to participate in a hearing if the proceeding will directly affect their rights or duties and is otherwise appropriate.
A request to intervene shall be by motion stating the reasons why intervention should be permitted.
Intervenors shall be considered full parties and shall have the same rights and duties as a party to a petition, with the following exceptions:
Intervenors shall not have an independent right to a hearing; and
Intervenors may participate only with respect to issues affecting them, as determined by the hearing examiner.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Notice of Final Rulemaking published at 33 DCR 1336, 1355 (March 7, 1986).
